list_definition.definition: the worry experienced by a person in particular circumstances, or the state of anxiety caused by this

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Her headaches may be caused by stress.

list_definition.definition: force exerted by (parts of) bodies on each other

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Bridge-designers have to know about stress.

list_definition.definition: force or emphasis placed, in speaking, on particular syllables or words

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: In the word ‘widow’ we put stress on the first syllable.

list_definition.definition: to emphasize (a syllable etc, or a fact etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Should you stress the last syllable in ‘violin’?
He stressed the necessity of being punctual.

list_ex_of_english: Rather, material structure is progressively broken up by increasing shear stresses.

If the final syllable does not have a long vowel or end in two or more consonants, the initial syllable is stressed.
Two points need stressing when explaining coding of this category.

Combined stresses are more likely to be encountered in the field than single stresses.
